description:
Welcome to the course Statistics and Correlation.

In this course, you will learn about Correlation in Statistics.

Correlation is a statistical measure that indicates to what extent two or more variables fluctuate together. This information is very much relevant in business decision making and this course will teach you

a) How to Compute Correlation?

b) What are the types of Correlation?

c) How to arrive at Corrrelation Coefficient using various methods?

d) How to arrive at Correlation in case of grouped data?

e) How to arrive at Rank Correlation.

This course will cover both the above concepts through

i) Explanation Lecture

ii) Practical Case Studies.

This course is structured in self paced learning style.

This course is suitable for Finance as well as Non Finance Students who would like to understand dispersion from the average data and its analysis.

Students taking up professional courses like CA / CMA / CS can take this course to understand this topic covered in their foundation level exams.

Under graduate students who have taken up Bachelor of Commerce, B Sc (Statistics) can also take this course.
title: Statistics and Correlation (for CA / CMA / CS / CFA Exams)
instructors: CA Raja Natarajan, B.Com., PGDBA, FCA
